title: This world's Globe celebrating the Globe experience
subject: Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616$$QShakespeare, William, 1564-1616 -- Songs and music
Shakespeare, William, 1564-1616 -- Appreciation
Monologues with music
Music -- England -- 16th century
Music -- England -- 17th century
contents: CD 1, The play's the thing. La Montagnura / Gasparo Zanetti ; arr. Lyons. "Speak gentlemen, what shall we do today?" / various texts, 1599-1626. Fanfare / arr. Lyons, after Cesare Bendinelli ; Hackney / Clement Woodcock ; "If music be the food of love, play on" : Orsino in Twelfth night I.1 ; &, The funerals / Anthony Holborne. &, "Enough, no more" : Orsino in Twelfth night I.1. Chromatic galliard / Thomas Simpson. "Is she that marchant's wife?" / West. King Richard's flourish / arr. Lyons, after Cesare Bendinelli. "When he doth hold conference upon the stage" / Cocke. "England, bound in with triumphant seas" : John of Gaunt in Richard II, II.1 ; &, Robin is to the greenwood gone / anon. ; arr. Lyons. Galliard 12 / Holborne. Torch pavan : Passe et medio/La Venissienne / Susato, Gervaise ; arr. Lyons. "But soft! What light" : Romeo in Romeo and Juliet, II.2 ; &, Romeo in love : Lull me beyond thee / Playford ; arr. Lyons. Piva / Joan Ambrosio Dalza ; arr. Lyons. "Sit in a full theater, and you will thinke" / anon., poss. Webster. "When let but Falstaffe come" / Digges. "Give me some music" : Orsino in Twelfth night II.4 ; &, My Earl of Essex's galliard / Dowland. New-yeeres gift / Holborne. Don Pedro's mask : Paduana del re / anon., Italy 16c. Hero's music : Sonata duodecima s. La Bergamasca) / Salamone Rossi. "A play is like a sinke in a towne" / Crosse. Fortune my foe / anon. ; arr. Lyons. "For within the hollow crown" : King Richard in Richard II, III.2. Patiencia / Holborne. Drums, flourish colours / arr. Lyons, after Cesare Bendinelli. "We are amazed" : King Richard in Richard II, III.2. Muy linda / Holborne. "The quick eares of" / Jonson. Hey, Robin / William Cornish. Heart's-ease / anon. ; arr. Takeuchi. The god of love : Gentil Madonna / anon., Italy 16c. Pardon goddess : Adoramus te Señor / Francisco de la Torre ; arr. Lyons. "Oft have I seene him, leap into the grave" : funeral elegy for Richard Burbage 1619. Belle qui tiens ma vie / arr. Lyons, after Thoinot Arbeau. "I have been study how I may compare" : King Richard in Richard II, V.5. On the cold ground / arr. Lyons, after Playford. "That hand shall burn" : King Richard in Richard II, V.5. Mille regretz / Tilman Susato. Battle jig = Pavane de la bataille / arr. Lyons, after Susato. "The world's a theatre" / Francis Quarles -- CD 2, Groundlings to gods. Vecchie letrose / Adrian Willaert. Lavolto / arr. McGowan, after Morley. Sharpe pavan / Ferrabosco II. Bobbing Joan / Playford. Almayne / Holborne. Paules steeple / anon. Bonny sweet Robin / McGowan. Ballo francese ; &, Schiarazula Marazula / Giorgio Mainerio ; arr. Lyons. Ungerische und auch Bauern Danntz ; Ein feines Täntzlein / arr. McGowan, after Augsburg, Linz organ tablature. A Pollish vilanell / Tobias Hume. Fandango / after Santiago de Murcia. Bransle de la torche / Michael Praetorius. Ladie lie neer me ; Bobbing Joe ; Stingo / after Weymyss lute book, Playford. Chorea polonica : no. 4 ; Alia Hungarica chorea : no. 32 / arr. McGowan after Vietoris Codex. Cushion dance / arr. McGowan after Playford. Mariana's song ; Take, o take, those lips away / arr. van Kampen, McGowan, after Vietoris Codex. Jota-tarantella / after Santiago de Murcia. Tant que vivray / after Claudin de Sermisy. Lachrimae pavin / arr. Morley, after Dowland. The batchelars delight / Richard Allison. Love's farewell / Tobias Hume. My Lord of Oxenfords maske / arr. Morley, after Byrd. Vilian de Spagna / Hieronymus Kapsberger. Lavolto / Morley. Galliard 24 / Holborne. Pavan dolorosa / Peter Philips. Galliard dolorosa / Philips. El tu tu / anon., arr. Lyons. Mount on horseback ; The Scot's march / after Rogers's virginals book. Lachrymae pavaen / Johann Schop, after Dowland. Mount on horseback ; Prince Rupert's march / after Rogers's virginals book. Heaven and earth / anon. "St. George for England" : King Edward in Edward II, III.3 ; & The battle of Boroughbridge / arr. McGowan, after Byrd. In the midst of life we are in death / after Merbecke. "So, bring us to our palace" : the Duke in Measure for measure, V.1 ; &, Final jig & playout.
relation: $$Cform$$VSource record: This world's Globe. Perivale, Middx, UK : Signum Classics, p2006$$QThis world's Globe.
lds65: Musicians (on period instruments) and cast of the Shakespeare's Globe Company ; William Lyons, Keith McGowan, Masters of Historical Music, research & arrangements ; Claire van Kampen, Master of Theatre Music, director of music.

btitle: This world's Globe celebrating the Globe experience

author: Lyons, William.
